page.title: 14Ghosts and Superstitions
page.content: In a house in St.Ruan a man saw a lady with a long white dress on.He thought it was his wife but then he saw it was a nun and he could see right through her.She disappeared into the cellar.The house used to be a priory.At Goonhilly on the pond there is meant to be a big galleon which goes past late at night.On Predannack in the 19th century there was the ghost of Thomas Flavel,former vicar of Mullion and rector of Ruan.The ghost was exorcised by another vicar. If you go fishing and see a rabbit or talk about one you do not catch any fish for the rest of the year.You have bad luck if you cut an elderberry down,if you turn a horseshoe upside down,if you break a mirror and the year you are thirteen.If your ears go red someone is talking about you.
